source.author: Wilson, K.L.
source.title: Cyperaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Wilson, K.L. (1994). Cyperaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves not obviously distichous; blades entirely covered with stomata adaxially
Leaves usually conspicuously distichous; blades with a median stomata-less longitudinal band adaxially between 2 faint or obvious ribs; apex of nut acute
Leaf-blade without or with 1–2 faint ribs adaxially; apex of nut an elongated cone, collapsing when mature
Leaf-blade with 3–6 evenly spaced ribs adaxially; apex of nut obtuse or truncate
